Squig Scourge 1.0 (Age of Sigmar) [970pts]

  • **Pitched Battle** 1,000 (Destruction - Gloomspite Gitz) [970pts]

    • Leader [290pts]

      • Fungoid Cave-Shaman [90pts]

        Selections: 4. The Hand of Gork, Arcane Bolt, Moon-sickle, Mystic Shield, Spore Maws, Spore Squig's Vicious Teeth

        Categories: WIZARD, Leader, HERO, DESTRUCTION, GROT, GLOOMSPITE GITZ, MOONCLAN, MOONCLAN WIZARD

        Magic: Fungoid Cave-Shaman, Spell: Arcane Bolt, Mystic Shield, Spore Maws, The Hand of Gork, Unit: Fungoid Cave-Shaman, Unit Abilities: Deffcap Mushroom, Mouthpiece of Mork, Spore Squig, Weapon: Moon-sickle, Spore Squig's Vicious Teeth


        Magic Cast/UnbindSpells Known Ref
        Fungoid Cave-Shaman 1/1Arcane Bolt, Mystic Shield, Spore Maws, one other from the Lore of the Moonclan
        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Arcane Bolt 5If successfully cast, pick an enemy unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. That unit suffers 1 mortal wound. If the casting roll was 10 or more, the unit suffers D3 mortal wounds instead.
        Mystic Shield 6If successfully cast, pick a friendly unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. Re-roll save rolls of 1 for that unit until your next hero phase.
        Spore Maws 7If successfully cast, each enemy unit within D6" of the caster suffers D3 mortal wounds.
        The Hand of Gork 7If successfully cast, pick 1 friendly GLOOMSPITE GITZ unit wholly within 24" of the caster, visible to them and more than 3" from any enemy units. Remove that unit from the battlefield and set it up again anywhere on the battlefield more than 9" from any enemy units. It may not move in the subsequent movement phase.
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Fungoid Cave-Shaman 5"446+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Deffcap Mushroom Once per battle, this model can attempt to cast 1 extra spell in your hero phase.
        Mouthpiece of Mork If this model is on the battlefield at the start of your hero phase, roll a dice. On a 4+ you receive 1 extra command point.
        Spore Squig Roll a dice each time you allocate a wound or mortal wound to this model. On a 4+ the wound or mortal wound is negated.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Moon-sickle Melee1"34+4+-11
        Spore Squig's Vicious Teeth Melee1"24+4+-1

      • Loonboss on Giant Cave Squig [110pts]

        Selections: 5. The Clammy Cowl, General - Loonboss with Squig, Massive Fang-filled Gob, Moon-cutta, Moonclan Stabba

        Categories: LOONBOSS, SQUIG-BOSS, DESTRUCTION, GLOOMSPITE GITZ, MOONCLAN, SQUIG, HERO, Leader

        Artefact: The Clammy Cowl, Command Abilities: Let's Get Bouncing!, Unit: Loonboss on Giant Cave Squig, Unit Abilities: Fly, Redcap Mushrooms, Weapon: Massive Fang-filled Gob, Moon-cutta, Moonclan Stabba


        Artefact Artefact Details Ref
        The Clammy Cowl Subtract 1 from hit rolls for attacks that target the bearer.
        Command Abilities Command Ability Details Ref
        Let's Get Bouncing! You can use this command ability at the start of your movement phase. If you do so, pick 1 friendly model with this command ability. All friendly SQUIG units wholly within 12" of that model at the start of that phase can move an extra 3" if they make a move in that phase. A unit cannot benefit from this command ability more than once per movement phase.
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Loonboss on Giant Cave Squig 2D6"664+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Fly This unit can fly.
        Redcap Mushrooms Once per battle, in your hero phase, you can say that this model is eating a redcap mushroom. If you do so, you can re-roll hit and wound rolls for this model’s Mooncutta or Moonclan Stabba until your next hero phase.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Massive Fang-filled Gob Melee1"44+3+-1D3
        Moon-cutta Melee1"53+4+1
        Moonclan Stabba Melee2"54+3+-1

    • Battleline [210pts]

      • Squig Herd [70pts]

        Selections: 5 Squigs & Squig Herder [70pts], Fang-filled Gob, Squig Prodder

        Categories: DESTRUCTION, GLOOMSPITE GITZ, MOONCLAN, SQUIG, Other, Battleline

        Unit: Squig Herd, Unit Abilities: Go Dat Way!, Squigs Go Wild, Unit Leader: Squig Herder, Weapon: Fang-filled Gob, Squig Prodder


        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Squig Herd 5"236+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Go Dat Way! You can re-roll run and charge rolls for this unit while it includes any Squig Herders.
        Squigs Go Wild Roll a dice each time a Cave Squig model from this unit flees, before the model is removed from play. On a 4+, the nearest other unit within 6" of the fleeing model suffers 1 mortal wound. If two or more of such units are equally close, you can pick which suffers the mortal wound.
        Unit Leader Leader Ability Ref
        Squig Herder 1 in every 6 models in this unit must be a Squig Herder model instead of a Cave Squig model. A Squig Herder is armed with a Squig Prodder instead of a Fang-filled Gob.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Fang-filled Gob Melee1"24+3+-11
        Squig Prodder Melee1"25+5+-1

      • Boingrot Bounders [200pts]

        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Boingrot Bounders 2D6"254+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Boing! Smash! After this unit has made a charge move, pick 1 enemy unit within 1" of this unit and roll a dice for each model in this unit. For each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.
        Fly This unit can fly.
        Lances of the Bounderz Add 1 to wound rolls for attacks made with this unit's Pokin' Lances if this unit made a charge move in the same turn.
        Unit Leader Leader Ability Ref
        Bounder Boss You can add 1 to hit rolls for attacks made with a Bounder Boss's Pokin' Lance.

      • Sneaky Shufflers [70pts]

        Selections: 6 Sneaky Snufflers [70pts], Gnashers, Loonfungus Sickle

        Categories: DESTRUCTION, GROT, GLOOMSPITE GITZ, MOONCLAN, Other

        Unit: Sneaky Shufflers, Unit Abilities: Looncap Mushrooms, Weapon: Gnashers, Loonfungus Sickle


        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Sneaky Shufflers 5"246+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Looncap Mushrooms At the start of your movement phase, you can say that this unit is harvesting looncap mushrooms. If you do so, it cannot move in that movement phase, but you can roll a dice. If the roll is less than or equal to the number of models in this unit, pick 1 friendly MOONCLAN unit wholly within 12" of this unit. Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of melee weapons used by that unit until your next movement phase. If you pick the same unit to be affected by this ability more than once in the same turn, it suffers 2D6 mortal wounds each time you pick it an additional time.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Gnashers Melee1"14+4+-1
        Loonfungus Sickle Melee1"14+4+-1

    • Allegiance

      • Allegiance

        Categories: Allegiance

        • Gloomspite Gitz

          Selections: Light of the Bad Moon

          Battle Trait: Bad Moon Magic, Fangz of the Bad Moon, Loonatic Inspiration, Lunar Squigs, Moonclan Fungus Brew, Spiderfang Venom, The Bad Moon, Troggoth Renewal


        Battle Trait Battle Trait Details Ref
        Bad Moon Magic Add 1 to casting rolls for WIZARDS affected by the light of the Bad Moon if they have the GLOOMSPITE GITZ keyword, and subtract 1 from casting rolls for WIZARDS affected by the light of the Bad Moon that do not have the GLOOMSPITE GITZ keyword.
        Fangz of the Bad Moon If your army is a Gloomspite Gitz army, at the start of your hero phase you can pick 1 enemy unit and roll a dice. If the roll is equal to or less than the number of models in that unit affected by the light of the Bad Moon, that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.
        Loonatic Inspiration If your general has the GLOOMSPITE GITZ keyword and is affected by the light of the Bad Moon at the start of your hero phase, you receive 1 extra command point.
        Lunar Squigs If all of the models in a friendly SQUIG unit are affected by the light of the Bad Moon at the start of your charge phase, that unit can attempt to charge even if it ran in the same turn.
        Moonclan Fungus Brew You can re-roll hit rolls of 1 for attacks made by MOONCLAN GROT models while they are affected by the light of the Bad Moon.
        Spiderfang Venom While a SPIDERFANG model is affected by the light of the Bad Moon, its Spider Venom ability causes mortal wounds on an unmodified hit roll of 5+ instead of 6.
        The Bad Moon If any of the armies in a battle are Gloomspite Gitz armies, at the start of the first battle round, before determining who has the first turn, the player commanding the Gloomspite Gitz army must pick one corner of the battlefield as the starting location of the Bad Moon. If both players have Gloomspite Gitz armies, then they must roll off and the winner picks the starting location. The Bad Moon is located at the edge of the battlefield in that corner, and its direction of travel is always diagonally across the map from its starting location. Starting from the second battle round, before determining who has the first turn, the player commanding the Gloomspite Gitz army must roll a dice. On a 1, the Bad Moon does not move. On a 2-5, it makes 1 move. On a 6, it makes 2 moves. Each move takes the Bad Moon from its current location along its direction of travel to the next location shown on the map. When a move takes the Bad Moon to the opposite edge of the battlefield, it is removed and has no further effect on the battle. The location of the Bad Moon determines which models are affected by its light. If the Bad Moon’s location is at the edge of the battlefield, its light does not affect any units. If the Bad Moon’s location is in a quarter, its light affects models wholly within the same quarter of the battlefield as its location. If the Bad Moon’s location is at the center of the battlefield, its light affects all models on the battlefield.
        Troggoth Renewal If all of the models in a friendly TROGGOTH unit are affected by the light of the Bad Moon when it uses its Regeneration ability, you can reroll the dice that determines if the ability heals any wounds, or you can double the number of wounds that are healed by the ability if the first roll is successful.

    • Game Options

      • Game Type

        Selections: 1000 Points - Vanguard
